title: Serial position effect graph - identify concept

content.description:
A memory researcher conducted a study to determine whether words are easier or harder to recall based on when they are presented in a sequence of words. She read a list of words to participants for 60 seconds at a constant rate. Each word was read once, and no words were repeated. The participants were tested on their recall of the words. The results are given in the graph.Â 

Number of Words Recalled as a Function of When Read

The Number of Words Recalled data for the 3 bars are as follows:

First 20 Seconds: 16

Second 20 Seconds: 8

Third 20 Seconds: 18
content.question: Which of the following concepts is consistent with these findings?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify psychology-related concepts in descriptions or representations of data.
